text: [Music]
at Zumba it would not have been possible
to scale to our size without using
[Music]
AWS my name is Alfred Moreno and I'm a
lead devops engineer for Zumba Fitness
Zumba Fitness is the world's largest
dance fitness program we have 14 million
classes being held in 140,000 different
locations in 150 different countries at
Zumba Fitness we sell books DVDs and
apparel online as well as instructor
registrations for all of our instructors
in 2009 we'd overcome the limitations of
our current hosting provider and we were
looking for a better storage medium for
all of our instructor images as a devops
engineer I've had the advantage of using
the AWS API in order to save myself a
lot of time and automate a countless
amount of things that would otherwise
have taken a lot of time configuring or
installing manually awss apis are a very
powerful feature because you can connect
with the Ruby SDK or any other language
SDK that you might need and perform a
large amount of tasks remotely that
would otherwise take a lot of time
through the Management console my
favorite aspect of working with AWS in
my position is that it's easy to start
and stop instances in any service AWS
provides in order to experiment with the
latest technology at Zumba we use aws's
ec2 service to host all the instances in
our service layer they're behind aws's
VPC so there's a secure channel of
communication from the public into our
VPC layer we Ed the New Relic demon on
all of our ac2 instances in order to
monitor our application performance so
from the very moment that you get a
request into your application to the
moment it completely talks to every
different aspect of your app you get an
overview of everything that's going on
how long things are taking and where
your pain points and refactoring points
might be at Zumba we use S3 to handle
about 7 tabt of traffic a month we use
aws's services for elasticache RDS for
databases and ec2 for compute instances
and we've been able to save about 39% of
our costs by using reserved instances my
experience working with AWS is that it's
been very easy to migrate a lot of our
solutions from anywhere else we've been
and to easily get things up and running
in aw us
